definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
sea of hatred is hard to fill (idiom); irreconcilable division
there are no rivers to one who has crossed the ocean, and no clouds to one who has passed Mount Wu (idiom)/one who has seen the world doesn't stop at small things
pinyin: ceng2 jing1 cang1 hai3 nan2 wei2 shui3 , chu2 que4 Wu1 Shan1 bu4 shi4 yun2
containing_words.word: 曾经沧海难为水，除却巫山不是云

sentences.english: In the comic book we are shipwrecked.
sentences.chinese: 在这本漫画书中，我们遭遇了海难。

sentences.english: The sailor who had lost everything by shipwreck said that he was thrown on his beam-ends .
sentences.chinese: 这位在海难中失去一切的水手说，他已经穷途末路了。

sentences.english: Kept lookout men on forecastle and crew-nest for salvage of sea casualty.
sentences.chinese: 为海难救助坚持在案首楼和了望台派设了望人员。

sentences.english: Salvage is a special legal system in maritime law.
sentences.chinese: 海难救助是海商法所特有的法律制度。

sentences.english: Kept lookout men On forecastle and crew—nest for salvage Of sea casualty.
sentences.chinese: 为海难救助坚持在艏楼和了望台派设了望人员。

sentences.english: The shipwrecked sailors were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇海难的水手已经被直升机救起。

sentences.english: No victim of the shipwreck has been found.
sentences.chinese: 海难的罹难者一个都没找到。

sentences.english: It was made around 150 BC, then lost in a shipwreck.
sentences.chinese: 它大约在公元150年制造，然后在海难中遗失。

sentences.english: There are many shipwrecks in these waters.
sentences.chinese: 在这些海域多海难事件。

sentences.english: Salvage at sea is a particular system of maritime law.
sentences.chinese: 海难救助是海商法的一项独特法律制度。

sentences.english: In fact, there are different accounts of the shipwreck in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，对于这次海难报纸上的说法不一。

sentences.english: The privateering ship was shipwrecked in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 私掠巡航船在风暴中遇海难。

sentences.english: The only survivor of a shipwreck was washed up on a small, uninhabited island.
sentences.chinese: 海难中唯一的幸存者被冲到一个无人居住的小岛上。

sentences.english: and in fact he claimed that it have happened.
sentences.chinese: 而且他还声称这场海难确实发生过。

sentences.english: We'll pull alongside her and put a salvage crew aboard.
sentences.chinese: 我们将靠上她的船，让海难救援人员上去。

definition: (of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
(of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
